responsibilities: Participate as a team member within a multidisciplinary research group.
Collaborate with senior staff on various projects.
Actively contribute to ongoing research by conducting literature reviews and summarizing findings.
Assist with the preparation of basic write-ups, reports, and presentations.
Support research methodology development, including data collection and analysis.
Demonstrate a strong willingness to learn and take direction while contributing to a collaborative and productive research environment.
qualifications: Eagerness to learn new concepts, tools, and methodologies in a fast-paced research environment.
Understanding of basic research methods, including literature reviews, data collection, and analysis.
Basic knowledge of organizing and interpreting data, with a willingness to learn statistical or analytical tools.
Ability to prioritize tasks, meet deadlines, and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Commitment to accuracy and thoroughness in all aspects of research and documentation.
Strong written communication skills with the ability to produce clear, concise, and professional reports and summaries.
Basic understanding of data collection methods and analysis.
Familiarity with tools such as Excel, SPSS, R, Stata, MATLAB, or Python is a plus.
Proven ability to work effectively in a team setting, demonstrating interpersonal and organizational skills.
analysis: The job responsibilities and skills listed do not explicitly mention Generative AI (GenAI) or language models (LLMs). The responsibilities focus on general research tasks such as literature reviews, data collection, analysis, and report preparation. The skills required include basic research methods, data organization, and familiarity with statistical or analytical tools like Excel, SPSS, R, Stata, MATLAB, or Python. While Python can be used for working with AI models, there is no specific mention of GenAI or LLMs in the job description. The emphasis is on general research and data analysis rather than AI-specific tasks.
